name: Canvas Offices
slogan: Boutique Office Spaces for the Creative Industry
description:
Canvas is a young and dynamic Co-working operator based in London, our unique and flexible approach to space as a service has already begun to shake up the industry. With 9 fully occupied sites in highly sought-after areas including Shoreditch, Old Street, Mayfair and Clerkenwell, and several new sites in the pipeline, our company is currently on a rapid growth trajectory.  

While our diverse community of tenants are busy innovating in a variety of industries including, fashion, fin-tech, design, digital media, and more - we help to ensure that their goals are just a little bit less challenging. How? By providing them with a bespoke office space that suits their business’ needs, and by creating a design led customer focused experience that fosters productivity, comfort, and convenience.

team.name: Oren Rosen
team.bioHtml: Lawyer.Founder @RNR Group.Boutique Office Operators. Legal@DA Music.

team.title: Head of Corporate Development
team.name: Amos Turin
team.bioHtml: MBA grad. Winner of EXIST startup Berlin 2016. Experience in corporate dev, investment, operations, and consulting in financial service and tech industries.

jobs.title: Head of Marketing
jobs.description:
Have you got what it takes to eat the big fish? At, Canvas we’re on the lookout for someone who can disrupt the way office space is marketed and stand out from the crowd.  We don’t have millions to spend on marketing, so we need to be more creative, work harder and think smarter to get noticed.  

And we’re clearly doing something right, with our company doubling in size last year and now we’re doing it again.  That means our family business is growing up.  So we are looking to create a strong marketing department to support our growth. This role is for someone entrepreneurial who is eager to learn from our two passionate co-founders (and brothers) and get stuck into the strategy as well as the implementation.  As this is truly a family business, we’re looking for someone who can play a key role now and in the long-term.  

At Canvas, we aim to be more than just a place where you go to work. Our spaces inspire and enable all our members to focus on what matters most – their business. We are grown up and know how important individuality is, so we bespoke all our spaces based on what you need.  We’re fully serviced and are here for you when you are ready to grow from start up to scale up. 

Our aim is to get x thousands of people to feel at home at work everyday.  

The new Head of Marketing will be responsible for engaging new customers through innovative lead generation, inspiring our existing clients with best in class community management, events and content and leading our growth strategy which includes the launch of our new brand identity. You should be confident in setting the marketing strategy as well as being able to execute the plans, deliver results and evaluate performance. You will report to our co-founders and work closely with the lean and keen team across sales and business development.

Main responsibilities
•Develop the Marketing strategy for Canvas, including the Who (targeting     strategy), What (messaging / creative strategy) and How (channel strategy). 

•Plan, execute and measure multi-channel marketing campaigns that are engaging, data-driven and customer-focused.

•Define goals and metrics to measure success and review performance on weekly, monthly & quarterly basis. 

•Create a roadmap of initiatives to ensure all new openings start off strong and maintain success.

•Develop plans to traffic, new customer acquisition and customer engagement across both digital (SEO, Paid Search, Affiliates, Email/CRM, Online Display, Social) and offline marketing channels (Press, Outdoor, Events). 

•Ensure the end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points are all living up to the brand purpose.

•Act as a brand guardian across all channels. Ensure all marketing communications promote the right message to the right target market and stick to brand guidelines.

•Maintain effective internal communications to ensure everyone in the business is kept informed of marketing activity.

•Daily communications with suppliers and agencies, such as Branding, PPC, Web, SEO, PR.

• Launch new website and keep it fresh and functional and ensure all social           media activity is on brand and engaging - including LinkedIn.

•Head up the email strategy and implementation.

•Manage all artwork and print activity.

•Network regularly with clients to stay up-to-date with the latest feedback   and opportunities.



You will be:
•A marketing guru with a bias in digital background and experienced with CMS/ CRM systems and analytical tools.

•Creative, original and have loads of personality.

•A self-starter, highly motivated and a champion of multi-tasking.

•Strong leader who can set direction, spot opportunities and create impact.

•Commercial and have a solid understanding of business drivers with the ability to evaluate campaign performance and ROI. 

•Super organised and a seriously good problem solver.

•Open to experimenting and driven to get things done in new ways. 

•Comfortable using data to make recommendations and drive decisions. 

•Fast on your feet, making smart decisions, meeting deadlines and keeping up in a fast-paced environment.

•Network regularly with clients to stay up-to-date with the latest feedback and opportunities.

•A marketing guru with a bias in digital background and experienced with CMS/ CRM systems and analytical tools.

•Creative, original and have loads of personality.

•A self-starter, highly motivated and a champion of multi-tasking.

•Super organised and a seriously good problem solver.

•Open to experimenting and driven to get things done in new ways.

•Comfortable using data to make recommendations and drive decisions.

•Fast on your feet, making smart decisions, meeting deadlines and keeping up in a fast-paced environment.
skills: Executing Strategy with pro active approach.

jobs.title: General Manager
jobs.description:
ABOUT CANVAS
We are Canvas, a young, dynamic and flexible workspace provider in London. We provide flexible office spaces, with all the features you need to create the right setting, as well as inclusive access to communal meeting rooms. We have a unique approach which has already started to shake up the industry. 

Whilst our diverse community of clients are busy disrupting a variety of industries (including, tech, fintech, design, digital media, and more), we help to make their goals just a little bit less challenging. How? By tailoring their office space to suit their business’ needs, and by creating a customer focused experience that fosters productivity, comfort, and convenience. 

With 9 fully occupied multi-tenanted sites in London, and a rapid growth trajectory, we are excited to provide the opportunity to join our tight knit team as Project Manager. 

JOB PURPOSE- General Manager
The General Manager (GM) would be responsible for all aspects of the day to day management of a number of buildings in our portfolio. 

Reporting to the company Head of Operations (HOO) and working together with the Deputy GM, key responsibilities of the General Manager role include:

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES 
•	Manage the day to day running of the existing offices and upcoming buildings
•	Oversee community management and client success
•	Management of the buildings’ operations
•	Support and help the company achieve its growth objectives
•	Manage the Deputy Manager as well as the development and mentoring of junior members of the operations team.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS, EXPERIENCE & KNOWLEDGE 
Requirements/Essentials:
•	Minimum 1 year experience as a Real Estate General Manager 
•	Managing the operations of an entire building 
•	Experience in the co-working/ building management/ “office as a service” industries
•	Demonstrable track record managing a diverse portfolio of clients
•	Managing and mentoring staff
•	Experience coordinating and project managing, including management of budget and deadlines
•	Implementing customer satisfaction survey for continuous improvement
•	Organising Events
•	Flexible mindset and willing to grow to more senior positions in the company
•	Friendly and can-do approach to people and challenges

Desirables
•	Ability to work in start-up environment
•	Managing multiple sites
•	Collaborative mindset – experience working with Finance and Sales 
•	Personable with the ability liaise with a wide array of clients
•	Solution Provider to client queries

WHAT WE OFFER
•	Highly Competitive Salary
•	Bonuses Based on the Company’s Performances 
•	Pension Contribution
•	Weekly Friday Drinks
•	Monthly Team Activities 
•	Annual Company Trips
